Reviews.Title: “Budget but certainly not boutique”
Reviews.Author: HumberBridgers
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a single night when I was working overnight in London and didnt fancy paying the higher prices of the chain hotels. Room was clean but didnt have room to swing a cat, so it was a good job I didnt have one with me. There was no shower in the room, which to be fair I may have missed when booking this. Positives - Small TV, Kettle with Tea and Coffee in room and free WiFi Negatives - No soap on sink, room was cold and couldnt get radiator to work. Breakfast was cold but edible if a little limited selection (although more than you get on the Continent!) While I would not stay there with Wife/Family for a leisure break it is OK if you just want somewhere to catch a couple of hours sleep while passing through London (on the way to Paris from St Pancras) of if you have an early morning meeting and dont want to pay the high train fare to get you into London before 10am. So I would consider using again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Eurostar and OK”
Reviews.Author: ukrelic
Reviews.Content: Taking my wife for a weekend in Paris I needed to cheap hotel in easy reach of the Eurostar terminal at Kings Cross St Pancras. We had a little issue finding the hotel on arrival but that was our fault although the hotel could have a better map on their web site. Hotel was clean quiet and very close just being a two minute walk from the station. Breakfast was full English not freshly cooked which made the eggs a little rubbery but well worth the money in my view. Room was small and shower appears to have been shoe horned into the eaves but had good water flow and you must remember this is not a five star price. I have put a video on you tube if you’re interested. You will hear the sqeekey floor boards LOL http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lyqk9qYgWlM http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jGUpFLfIpJs Stairs to room were narrow and if you’re disabled or fat you may find access difficult Hotel was very quiet and had staff at reception all night so will stay again next time. Booking in and out was painless. We paid £65 bed and breakfast for 2 Breakfast was served from 7am on the Friday which meant we had plenty of time for our 8:30 train.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms small with VERY noisy floorboards”
Reviews.Author: dacory
Reviews.Content: Great location for Kings Cross. The hotel is in a quiet road with parking outside. Unfortunately floor boards very noisy and really felt sorry for people underneath us. Room was very small with no room to move around, had to leave suitcase in bathroom or climb over beds to get around room. Neither TV or radio working and lamp flickered when attempted to use Corridors and stairs very narrow and fire exits blocked with decorating materials and mattresses. Left too early for breakfast, although is included in price. Hair dryers available upon request behind reception. Room not as clean as could be, but bedding very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: MVC499
Reviews.Content: Very good location close to King's Cross and St Pancras stations. £50 for a single ensuite room was very reasonable. It was clean and had everything you need, including tea making stuff. TV and hair dryer. It also included breakfast which was basic but OK. The staff on reception were VERY pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great for small back packers”
Reviews.Author: bevvy_babe
Reviews.Content: Must say firstly this place is in a great location to St Pancras and for one night it is sufficient Â£90 a night for a shoe box with no frills seems a bit steep. My daughter and I had hardly any room for our bags, I would not advise anyone with large cases to stay here as it is very difficult to manoeuvre about. This would probably be great for backpackers except for the price, though they would need to be small if more than one in a room.

Reviews.Title: “Best low budget hotel I have stayed at in London”
Reviews.Author: Debsid
Reviews.Content: One night stay for business and usually book the cheapest rooms available. THis was only Â£50 for single ensuite and breakfast. Room was actually a double room so more space. Clean and basic but perfectly fine. Breakfast buffet style, quick and easy and good quality. Staff pleasant. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location......”
Reviews.Author: Reed S
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed the California Hotel recently for 3 night and enjoyed our stay. The room was small (Never had anything but a small room in London), and a little run down, but it was clean and comfortable. I actually think the large modern bathroom was bigger than the rest of the room, but we only slept there any ways. It had a small TV with 4 channels, and a small desk for the Laptop. The room was fairly quiet, and didnâ€™t notice any of the usual street noise you usually find in a big city. We also had a good free WI-FI signal. The breakfast was in the lower level and had all the basic English stuff : Bangers, beans, tomato, bread. and it was fine overall. The hotelâ€™s best feature was location. We took the airport tube all the way from Heathrow to Kings Cross (no transfers) and then only a 5 min. walk to the Hotel. When we left we walked 5 mins. Over to St. Pancras and took the train to Paris. There are also several restaurants, markets, shops and fast food joints within a short walk. My brother is hard to please, but we both enjoyed the hotel and its convenient location I would definitely recommend it, and stay here myself again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: PaleGale
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for eight nights in October 2011. The hotel has fairly small rooms but the location is excellent and close to the tube station and railway (Kings Cross). Our room was on the first floor and had barely enough room to turn around in however from past experiences with London stays we were not expecting a large room. The room was clean, plain and somewhat dated. They had just installed new wall mounted televisions in the rooms. We also had wireless service in our room. We have stayed at this hotel before and that was mostly due to the budget price, excellent breakfast and central location. This time we found the room to be exceptionally hot and they seemed unable to adjust the heat. Opening the window was not an option as we were on the street level and there was a great deal of street noise at all hours. We were given a fan but it was not the best solution.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the train, that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: pbirdie3
Reviews.Content: Pros: Train station is one block. Underground is at the corner. Staff was helpful with directions and gave us a converter. Fairly quiet. Cons: Room decor was like being at your cabin. TV did't work. Breakfast included but left a little to be desired. Bathroom had only one light in the ceiling, so you couldn't really use the mirror it was so dark. Shower was fine. No temperature control in the room so we had to leave window open with no screen, hello pigeons. Window rattled. At $165 a night, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive"A hidden gem"”
Reviews.Author: Charlie G
Reviews.Content: We had a family gathering and this hotel accomodated us all, which was a feat in it's self. We had children, teenagers,and disabled all in our group and they were all looked after brilliantly.The rooms were spotlessly clean,water hot(even at 1am!) staff we extremely accomadating and professional and happy.The free parking outside the hotel after 1:30pm from Sat-Mon was a big bonus. We had the family room and were plesantly impressed with the size. The down side was, it was a little bit noisy(proves how popular it is) and a little on the warm side(they did provide a fan) but it would not put me off staying again.We will definately be using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic room for a night”
Reviews.Author: LeedsDunc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night after flying into heathrow. Room is clean, comfortable but very basic and small, stayed in a room near the back of then hotel and had no problem with noise. Breakfast was basic but fine, cereal, bacon, sausage tomatoes, eggs, beans and toast. For the price for a one night stay donâ€™t think there is anything wrong. If I was staying for multiple nights would increase my budget and look for somewhere better.

Reviews.Title: “A Hostel rather than a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarahNorwich86
Reviews.Content: This is much more of a hostel than a hotel, rooms are basic but adequate although not the greatest shower, it was either freezing cold or boiling hot. It was clean but the hotel was quite noisy, you could hear people in other rooms. Generous breakfast if you like greasy fried food but sadly there isn't really an alternative. However it is a good location, just next to Kings Cross station.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: SueinEssex
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel, right across the road from St Pancreas and Kings X Stations. The idea was we stayed there for one night and the following day went on the Eurostar to Paris. That didn't work out at all because I was taken ill in the night, but the staff were very helpful and I cannot fault them. The room we had on the ground floor was pretty small, but they managed to cram in a double and a single bed, which was fine for an overnight stay. My husband said the breakfast was good too. We paid Â£90 for the two of us, bed and breakfast, with our own bathroom. The room had tea making facilities and a hairdryer, although for some reason, no soap although there was the usual gel soup dispenser in the shower. However, you cannot complain at that for this price in Central London. We will definitely stay there again on our next trip via Eurostar. They have clearly tried to make the rooms as smart as they can, and even included a decent sized samsung TV too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every way”
Reviews.Author: Phillip J
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night and if you want central London this is the one. The Hilton its not, the California it is. Rooms clean and tidy, good buffet breakfast and polite staff. Anyone who wants to slate these cheap central hotels, book the Hilton. Will stay again and wouldnt hesitate to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, handy for Euston & Kings Cross”
Reviews.Author: SEASIDEJOHN
Reviews.Content: I only stayed for 1 night so tried to pick a cheap hotel handy for Euston. When I arrived I realised I was right across teh road from Kings Cross, great, hardly a 2 min walk to catch my train early next morning. The room was quite big with double and a single, I tried to get the wi-fi working but had to go to the desk and ask for a code, the chap that signed me in asked how my room was, I said excellent, really clean and ample for me, he told me some Danish guests had just refused the room!! The room was really clean, freshly decorated and had a great tv, tea & coffee too. The only downside but I am being quite picky, was the shower, it was big enough but looked like it should have had 2 glass doors, there was only 1 and a curtain, still it was adequate. The hotel has a bar which had a few people in although I didn't use it and the breakfast next day smelt good but I was in a rush and didn't have any. I was in London all day on business and didn't want to carry my case around with me all day and the hotel looked after it until I returned at 5pm. An excellent hotel in easy reach of all the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “not great”
Reviews.Author: treejon
Reviews.Content: Its only good bits are its location and the breakfast, its more like a youth hostel than a hotel, very small and cramped rooms hardly enough room to put 2 suitcases in, but we chose it for its location near to st pancras station and its 500 yards from the front door. So it suited our needs for 1 night stay, if you need a base for an extended stay in london there are better hotels

Reviews.Title: “Most awful experience & condescending staff”
Reviews.Author: Jenni L
Reviews.Content: Was supposed to stay here for a couple of nights while doing business in London. The people in reception are mean spirited (especially Daniel), the most rude person I have ever met. I had some questions about the area, and he was not only not helpful, but was completely unprofessional, and condescending. Not sure why this person works in customer service. I would not stay here again if this was free. It ruined my whole trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, stayed before & will again!”
Reviews.Author: bunnykinz
Reviews.Content: Yes, ok this isn't a top notch hotel but when you want cheap & chearful this is the place to stay! Excellent location. Breakfast, eggs, sausage, bacon, toms, beans, toast, jams & butter, cornflakes,orange juice, tea & coffee! 5 of us stayed myself, my mum (oap) 21yr old, 15 yr old, & 12 yr old so had the family room 4 single beds, 1 double which were extremely comfortable. Yes, you can hear the tube but noise from it is faint and anyway, when you've trecked around london all day, getting to sleep is no problem!! Staff very helpful & chearful. Basically we love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Functional”
Reviews.Author: MadStadRoyals1871
Reviews.Content: A reasonably friendly welcome at front desk, my credit card charged before I saw the room. I wasn't expecting too much for my Â£90. I got a twin room, towels and a bathroom of sorts. It was an extremely hot & humid night, so windows open and gasping for air. I suspect the hotels around us catered for the same market and charged similar prices. This hotel is, though, all about location, location, location. Literally 5 minutes walk from St. Pancras Station. Cooked breakfast included in the price but served from 7am, too early for us due to our train departure time, we were informed that something cold may be available, when we got down to breakfast at 6:30am the breakfast was indeed available and in keeping with the hotel, it was rather average.

Reviews.Title: “Good price/quality”
Reviews.Author: PaoloP66
Reviews.Content: Very close (100 m) to King's Cross tube station, Hotel California is the best value for a London weekend. Rooms are tight, but clean. English breakfast excellent

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a stay the night before catching Eurostar”
Reviews.Author: Sheltielover5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights before taking the Eurostar to Disneyland Paris. We normally stay in Victoria when in London but wanted somewhere closer to the Eurostar terminal this trip and this hotel is just across the road from St Pancras/Kings Cross so easy access into central London. We picked this hotel because it was the most reasonably priced one that would sleep my family of 5. We had a basement room for 6, (a double and 4 single beds) and there was plenty of room for us all. The cooked breakfast was a welcome start to the day, our room although basic was very clean and comfortable, also a decent size safe, free wifi and friendly, helpful staff. I'd have not hesitation staying here the night before catching the Eurostar again.

Reviews.Title: “God Awful”
Reviews.Author: lucky-oldie
Reviews.Content: Wanted an hotel in this location and used Trip Advisor to guide. In this experience a wrong move. The double room provided (3rd floor) was ridiculously small. There was no elevator and the stairs were incredibly narrow and steep. There was no room for bags/cases. The tiniest ever TV was hidden inside a closet. The bathroom was ultra small. There is no daily room clean, nor linen or towel exchange. The room had no place to hang the wet bathtowels - yet we were expected to make do over a several day stay using same towels. No bathmat was provided, even though shower screen deposited water onto floor. While the room had been cleaned, the carpet and paint were so old that they were stained dirty. The bathroom was similarly grime laden. Noise from occupants on the floor above, from the room next door and those walking in the corridor were easily heard. If quantity is the only breakfast criteria, then OK. The food provided was of the poorest quality, overcooked, and the options minimal. Staff do their job, but they don't make you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for St Pancras”
Reviews.Author: loxton
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before and after our trip to Disneyland Paris, after reading some of the other reviews I was apprehensive about staying here but it is clean, provides a cooked breakfast and is a 5 minute walk to St Pancras and Kings Cross. The room I had on my first night was in the basement with a lot of stairs leading down to it but I managed, the room I had on my return was better as only one flight of stairs, only awkward because of my suitcase. There is a reception area where you can sit and also an outside terrace for the smokers. The rooms are small but if you are using for a stop over they are fine. Free Wi Fi as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Sarah0310
Reviews.Content: Stayed the weekend at this hotel, wasn't expecting great things for the price we paid. However, the hotel was clean and tidy, the staff were very pleasant and the breakfast was fantastic! The location was also great, very central. The only negative was that the room was extremely warm, however, I would definetly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It has its plus points”
Reviews.Author: LittleOl
Reviews.Content: For a hotel right next to Kings Cross complete with breakfast this is fairly cheap. Location good and generally the experience is ok for a hotel on a budget. The staff were friendly and helpful at the reception desk and we were told where our room was - on the top floor. The corridors are tiny as are the staircases. There is no lift. The room was tiny with two small single beds. However, for a place to put your head down it was clean and basic. The shower has low pressure and be very careful about the water as it is easily scalding hot. The TV was old but it worked. For somewhere to rest my head it was adequate and not as bad as some of the reviews I had read. Pictures on their information leaflets do not match all of the rooms. I am sure that one or two have been done up - but not ours! The main problem is at breakfast. There were some staff (not enough) and nobody seemed to have a specific job. You help yourself to the tables (not a good idea when it is busy) and find that those from cultures that are not used to queing will simply push you out of the way if you are not careful. It took ages to find someone to clear the table from the previous guest. The food was adequate but no great choice. The sausage was a sausage in appearance but not when you eat it. The rest of the food tasted fine but it is bacon, egg, sausage, beans, tomatoes, toast, museli and that is it. The orange juice is very watered down. At one point they ran out of plates, and then cutlery. When asked they did wash some - but only knives and forks for four people (and I took two sets). Generally the breakfast was ok but the process of getting breakfast was not the greatest. They need to be organised. Someone needs to manage the dining area making sure that guests are looked after. The dark haired waitress needs to realise that a place like this needs a little speed - she glided across the floor as if there was nothing important to do. I have never seen anyone clear a table so slowly! To summarise - if you want a no frill (and I mean no frills) place to rest your head in the centre of London this place is ideal. There is no room to swing a cat but it is extremely clean and the staff are friendly. If you want a little comfort then this is not the place for you. Compared with the prices close by it isn't bad and there are much worse places. After checking out we had time before our train and went to McDonalds for a coffee. There was a hotel near there that really looked bad from the outside - made the California look quite smart!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Vancouver21
Reviews.Content: I needed easy access to King's Cross and Piccadilly lines (arriving on Eurostar, leaving via Heathrow), so I chose the hotel because it is literally across the street from King's Cross. I wasn't expecting much as I've stayed in other hotels on the same street, but I was surprised by the value I received for my money. Basic, but clean. They have a luggage room with locked door if you need to leave your bags for a few hours. The only problem was the free wireless they promised was available in the lobby only because of the distance between my room and the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “great location and newly decorated room”
Reviews.Author: LondonBonbon
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff! The rooms we stayed in were in the basement and had been newly decorated- and looked great, very colourful and fresh. For great location and convenience would definitely recommend and stay again!

Reviews.Title: “... at least the location is good.”
Reviews.Author: Dave-from-Queensland
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because we had to walk to the St Pancras station by 6 the next morning to catch teh Eurostar to Paris. For that reason it is great. However, the rooms were VERY SMALL - only just enough room for a double bed and space to change your clothes\. the shower was tiny and crammed under a staircase, the toilet of a similar size. (I coudn't find the toilet until I looked in the wardrobe! One wardrobe door lead into the toilet!) There was a small and dangerous step up into the bed. To get into the room required us to go down four steps then immediately up another four - odd. Not a pleasant outlook - were were at the back of the hotel overlooking backyards, and the open windows let in a bit of noise. We put up with this because we just wanted aroom to sleep in and to be close to the station. We still had to pay for breakfast even though we were leaving before it was served. The desk staff were friendly and helpful. We didn't experience the dining room or other aspect of the hotel. Later we stayed at Heaves Hotel in Cumbria - the ensuite bathroom alone there was bigger than this whole room!

Reviews.Title: “It was fine for us!”
Reviews.Author: MelFinch
Reviews.Content: Oh dear, this hotel has such a wide variety of reviews that I did worry occasionally before we left, but it really does seem to depend on which room you get and maybe which member(s) of staff are on duty at the time. We (two grandparents, two parents plus one four-month-old baby) had a weekend in London for a nephew's wedding, and stayed two nights, having chosen this place because of its proximity to St Pancras where we arrived by train, and also to the wedding reception venue just round the corner at the Canal Museum. We paid Â£85 per night for each twin room, and ended up with two on the ground floor just along the corridor, one with a comfy large cot and a bit more space, both on the back so quite quiet, narrow but perfectly OK beds, all quite clean, a bath as well as a shower, a bit hot when we arrived as the sun was shining right in, but overnight with the window open at the bottom we all slept fine. We hope the baby didn't disturb others, but most of the time she behaved beautifully. The lovely Roumanian receptionist who was on duty all weekend couldn't do enough to help us, and remembered us from when we first entered the hotel. The breakfast room in the basement is rather noisy because of the stone floors and scraping chairs and people's voices getting louder and louder with the echo, so breakfast isn't a quiet affair if the hotel is busy. As other people have said, it's mostly a substantial basic hot breakfast plus some cereal and toast. The staff down there were prompt to serve tea and coffee. There is a high chair but our baby isn't quite big enough for this. However we managed fine between us. They were fitting new carpets in the corridors while we were there, so perhaps it's undergoing a general makeover and will look a bit less scruffy in time. So it suited us fine.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel California in London is a horrible hovel”
Reviews.Author: paul22luap
Reviews.Content: The worst excuse for a "hotel" that will at least encourage you to get out into London to sight-see rather than spend another second in this horrible hovel. I'm adding pricey because they should charge about 20% of their going rate for this shabby dirty hole. If you're lucky enough to get the 4th floor, you get to haul everything up narrow stairs and multiple hallways - No Elevator. The floors are covered in hallway and rooms with very old worn dirty carpeting. The shower is a very narrow tiled space with a fixed shower head and a hole in floor, not adjoining the bathroom, and has no hooks for clothes/towels... If you're looking for an Anne Frank/Dachau/Holocaust Holiday Experience, then this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Ok minus”
Reviews.Author: KarolineP
Reviews.Content: Hotel California is located very close to King's Cross and has great subway/tube connections. The rooms are very small. I stayed in room 202 with two other friends. It was one single bed and one double bed. The double bed had a double-quilt. This is not OK when you stay with friends. We requested an extra quilt and got it the next day. We had a hard time sleeping becuase there was not enough oxygen flow in the room. Even when we opened the window as much as we could, we felt a bit sufficated. The reson was a large ventilation "chimney" outside our window. In the morning, the smell of fried food came in to our room. The bathroom was a plus. It was freshly renewed. The ventilator in the bathroom was noisy and didn't have much effect. Therefore, there were a bit of fungus in the ceiling above the shower/bathtub. The first couple of days there was no bars of soap in the bathroom, but we got one two days before we left. There was soap in the shower, but that was hard to reach when you stood outside the shower. The room could need a coat of paint. It was cleaned almost every day, and we got new towles. The bathroom (and the room) lacked a place to hang our towels, so we ended up handing it up over our bathroom "door" and over the double closet. The English breakfast was OK. The staff was mostly friendly. When we asked for a cab, the receptionist called a minicab who couldn't find the way to where we were going. It was more expencive than the night tax of the London Cab, too. We got free wireless internet access when we asked for it, which was a huge plus! In the "lobby" og lounge room, there was also a comuter. Â£1 for 20 minutes.The Internet was a bit "on-again, off-again, but that was OK). The hotel had a small backyard with some chairs and tables. I cannot remember how many floors the hotel had (3 or 4, I believe), but there was no elevator. This was impractical when we came and left with a lot of luggage. Because we were on a school trip, we needed inexpensive rooms. Hotel California is quite inexpensive, and a totally OK hotel. Some of our fellow students had ants in their room, and some had strange bathroom solutions (they had to go inside their closet and down a staircase to get to their tiny bathroom). There was also found larvas in a towel (but that could be a coinsidence). One teacher had a single-room, and she was freezing all four nights. If you are only going to sleep in your hotel and you want to live quite central for little oney, I will recomend Hotel California (mostly because it is so close to the King's Cross subway). If you want a place with more space, I would recomend you to find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: dibdobdeb
Reviews.Content: I was very hesitant about staying here after reading some reviews especially as i had children with me. i have to say i was pleasently suprised. we had the family room in 'the basement' it was big clean and served our requirements. staff where polite and very helpful. would definantly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel - this is a dumpy, rude hostel at inflated prices”
Reviews.Author: rsmallfoot
Reviews.Content: This place is NOT a hotel. This is a hostel at inflated hotel prices. This place is old, dirty and highly worn out. The prices are astronomical for what you get - completely ridiculous. Further, the front desk is very, very rude. The front desk is staffed with kids who do not care at all about customer service. Mold everywhere !!!! Window sills, bathroom grouting...mold, mold, mold. Dirty carpet and the TV is from 1980's. They advertise free internet - but forget it - it does not work. Stay away from this place even if you find a great deal on this place. Horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyGeorge
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend and was pleasantly surprised. Yes the room is small but our room was spotlessly clean. The staff were friendly and you cannot fault the location. Obviously if you chose to stay central you are going to have noise albeit I had a back room and was fine. I would stay again and favour this hotel to some of the travelodges.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't sleep”
Reviews.Author: JonathanDD
Reviews.Content: I booked into the hotel for one night on 30 Nov. The room was small but clean (apart from the sink which was blocked). I was in room 302. When I returned to the room at night to go to bed there was a very loud mechanical sound for ten secs every minute directly outside my room. I put up with it till 4am but really couldn't sleep or rest. The staff moved me to room 203 (on the floor below). Sadly I could still hear the same sound although it was a but quieter. Under normal circumstances the size and cleanliness of the room would've been fine for the price but because I couldn't get any sleep in either of the rooms because of the noise the experience was disappointing. I asked the duty manager for a discount and am awaiting their response.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the money”
Reviews.Author: csa_travel
Reviews.Content: Needed to catch an early Sunday Morning Eurostar from St Pancras and it was difficult to find a room anywhere near the station. I was a bit apprehensive given some of the reviews but I must say I was pleasantly surprised. Okay the room and ensuite are small but my room was clean and the bed comfortable. Its a bit basic and the floors are creaky and there are some noises of central heating pumps(?) but didnt stop me from sleeping.On a very cold weekend the room was comfortable and warm The Hotel is just accross the road from St Pancras / Kings Cross and could not be more convenient - although this a very busy area the hotel felt safe. Breakfast Buffet was simple but plentiful and the quality was good. It may have a few rough edges but I have stayed in less convenient places which have charged much more and havent been better. All things considered - if I need to do the same journey again I wouldnt hesitate to rebook.

Reviews.Title: “dont stay there”
Reviews.Author: denmar13
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel we have ever stayed , we had to climb three sets of stairs with all our luggage ,for us it was grubby, the shower and toilet was a converted cupboard so you can imagine the size of it and to make matters worse they are trying to charge us twice. Just dont go there Demmis and Margaret May

Reviews.Title: “Good value and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jimandbevh
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel for its location and value. We were in London as tourist. It delivered on both points with some extras as well. We were a few steps from the King's Cross train and tube station and there were many places to eat in the near vicinity. It is also a short walk from the British Museum. The hotel was very clean throughout. The lobby area was good with comfortable chairs to visit with friends. The hotel is 3 stories and no lift. Ask for rooms not on the third floor as it is a climb for "mature" folks. All the room scheduling is done manually which means it is difficult to change rooms at the last minute. The staff was very helpful in trying to accommodate a room change request but it was difficult. Breakfast was included in our rate and could have been a plus. The quality of the coffee did not meet our American tastes which was our biggest complaint. If you drink tea that will not matter to you. It was buffet style so you can pick and choose from and variety of cooked and cold selections. I would recommend the hotel for the location, the cleanness, the staff, and value with an understanding that I was not paying for a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: Shook_Singapore
Reviews.Content: - The single room is tiny and no space after I put my backpack on the floor. - I found hair on the bed. - Dusty and wet carpet. - Dirty window frames. - The shower has gone out of water when I was half way showering! I have to use the tap for my shower. Only cold water from the tap, due to the heaty faulty. It was December, 11pm in London. Was totally freezing. - I complaint and requested to change the room. They gave me a double room. It is better but still horrible. The mattress was thin (about 5cm only ) and too soft - I paid 70euro for one night but I can get a 10x better hotel in some other places in Europe. - What a bad memories in London! :-(

Reviews.Title: “Great if you want to be near King's Cross/St.Pancreas.”
Reviews.Author: wtgn_ling
Reviews.Content: It was our 1st visit to London and we booked a triple room at this property because of its location opposite the King's Cross station. It was really good to be near the Underground station as we can go anywhere in London from there. However the neighbourhood seems a little quiet and did not have too much shopping/sights which is slightly disappointing for us. The English breakfast served daily could do with an occasional change. The counter was staffed 24 hours a day and the free wireless was a plus point for us. Although bed is a tad too soft for our liking, we will choose to stay there again when next visiting London.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel, very clean and safe, 24 hour front desk”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler57Usa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights on our recent UK trip, renting 2 rooms for our family. Rooms were very clean and windows were helpful (luckily we arrived right after the heat wave). No A/C but lovely breeze. Staff was very friendly, breakfast was OK, not great. But the location is perfect right across from St Pancras/King's Cross but on a side street. Our room at the back was very quiet, the other room on the front was noisier but nothing ear plugs couldn't handle. Wireless works in the lobby but not in the rooms. There is a computer there but you pay by the minute.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, central, good”
Reviews.Author: kiki3105
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is 2 minutes from King's Cross, but in a quiet side road. The rooms are clean and the people very nice and helpful. Breakfast was OK. My plane left late at night and I was allowed to leave my luggage at the hotel, to enjoy one last day of sightseeing. The room had a bed, desk, free wlan, flatscreen TV, wardrobe and an ensuite bathroom with a shower. The rooms are not huge, but enough for one person for a few days. The only thing that I didn't like was that the room smelled of smoke, even though it was a non-smoker room. But I guess I can thank my addicted predecessor for that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: sunlover51Lancashire
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, I have to say the hotel was in a great location near to all the buses and tubes. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms although not very big were clean and fresh towels daily. The buffet breakfast was excellent and again the staff friendly. I have stayed in London many times and I am so pleased my friend told me of this hotel which is well priced. I would recommend using the buses which are far better value for money and are so frequent from Kings Cross to all the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: SStrawb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in November, shared a triple room. Room was small but adequate for our one night stay, paid about Â£30 each. Beds were comfy, bedding was clean, room was quiet. We made good use of the tea and coffee making facilities in the room. Bathroom was dated and in need of a spruce up but once again for one night on a budget it was fine. Breakfast was basic but plentyful, toast, bacon, beans and I think there were eggs, we were able to help ourselves to what we wanted and the coffee was strong! For a short break in London when you just want somewhere comfy to sleep, I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Relocated from the Howard Winchester”
Reviews.Author: GrunfSweden
Reviews.Content: To this "sister-facility". Quite a poor hotel, with cramped rooms and not so much focus on clenliness. Choose something else if possible.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: pragmatopian
Reviews.Content: We asked for a double room: we got a room with four single beds and one broken double bed. All beds had wafer-thin mattresses. The bathroom was reasonably appointed but quite dirty. The view from the window was to a small balcony for smokers. The only strong point was the proximity of Kings Cross and St. Pancras stations. The price was relatively cheap for a central London hotel room, but this is reflected in the poor quality of the accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect from a London budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: teabag80
Reviews.Content: This is at the cheaper end of London hotels and you get what you pay for. We were only staying a night and it was perfectly adequate for that but if I had been staying longer, I would have chosen somewhere else. It was what you would expect from a no-frills hotel in London, our room was a decent size and the bathroom was clean but our friends' room had a broken window which wouldn't close (luckily it was a mild October!) and rather than a proper bathroom they had more of a wet room-shower was just a head on the ceiling and a drain on the floor. Breakfast was disappointing. It was self service but staff were rushed off their feet, they kept running out of cutlery and the food was cold. I would be happy to stay in a no frills London hotel again but would probably try elsewhere. It was a good location for Euston and St Pancras though.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute hellhole”
Reviews.Author: sianbo1
Reviews.Content: The room we had was pretty horrendous - no windows just a skylight, which was covered in rubbish. If there'd have been a fire, we'd have struggled to get out. Mattress was skinny as anything, bathroom was reasonable, but grubby around the edges and rubbish loo roll. Rubbish behing the bin from last visitor.Carpet had sticky patches on it, from what, I dread to think!! Room was unbearably hot and couldn't turn the heating down on the radiators, just wouldn't turn. Didn't want to chance eating there so can't comment. The worst thing was, the room absolutely REEKED of fags. Close to tube... about the only good point. I really wouldn't advise stating here - it cost us about Â£70 for the night - so do some research and go somewhere else. What a dump!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay with young children/ or disabilty”
Reviews.Author: Hulligans
Reviews.Content: The hotel was reasonably clean, locally sitauated. Nice breakfast..Those are the best points. On the other hand it has no lift and all the staircases are very narrow and winding, so no good for anyone who has a disability, there are a few rooms on the main level but these are very noises with the walk through. We were put on the 3rd floor on our first night (3 rooms), 4 women and 5 kids ages 8-12, probably thought we would be noisy put them out the way, but our cases were heavy and the stairs were a nightmare to tackle, this visit was prior to going to Eurodisney. On our second stay (after Eurodisney) we ask for more managable rooms we were again put in 2 rooms on the 3rd floor and myself and my daughters were put in the basement next to the kitchen and resturant. We must of heard everything the kitchen staff was talking about at 5.30 in the morning. Not pleasant when we was exhausted after our travels. A couple of the kitchen staff got stroppy with us when my sister helped to clear a couple of tables for them, Overall I wouldn't recommend this hotel as it was overpriced, for the value of service you recieve.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: patten13
Reviews.Content: Decent budgethotel at a good price and an excellent location. Staff friendly except the girls in the breakfastroom who didn't care very much. Triple room was not very big but we had a nice bathroom with excellent shower. Would go back on a next citytrip to London.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the Hotel California”
Reviews.Author: scatti1
Reviews.Content: I thought htis hotel was an excellent find. close to Kings Cross St Pancras. we stayed in a room sleeping 6 adults (yes, not restricted to 2 adults 4 kids!) remarkable value for the 5 of us that stayed for Â£22 each! ROOM: in the basement. amazingly quiet when you consider the station is literally 200yds away. clean, recent refurbishment but still a little shabby if you looked close enough. small wardrobe, 4 drawers. BED/BEDDING: Clean and fresh. wooden, box built beds all of which were fairly comfortable. 1 towel per bed. HOTEL OVERALL: warm welcome at reception, shown to our room, offered for us to sit in lounge when we arrived back at 2am, but no bar so declined! (hehe). missed breakfast so can't comment, but smelled nice and the people in the room above said it was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: lindaMidlands
Reviews.Content: we had a tiny room at the top of the hotel, no lift and narrow stairs, difficult getting case to room. mattress was ripped and dirty and extremely uncomfortable. complained this was removed. no soap in toilet. wardrobe doors could not be opened fully due to doors opening on to bed. will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “A JEWEL OF A FIND !”
Reviews.Author: JayveeSheffield
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from an overnight stay at the California - brill find for a budget hotel in central London: friendly,helpful staff, a reasonable residents lounge area with a little outside patio adjacent to the lounge - perfect for quiet moments in which to savour the sun - if you are lucky ! I booked a single room which was a very reasonable size (in fact it was a twin) I had a full bathroom with both bath and shower and plenty of CLEAN white towels. I also had a little tray with a kettle, tea, coffee etc in my room..a small portable TV was also in the room (though I never watched it - so unsure about quality of reception) The breakfast was well cooked and adequate: self service: bacon,sausage,beans, eggs, toast,cereal and juices together with hot drinks were available......Lets get real here DO NOT expect 5 * luxury this is a budget hotel but as I said an absolute gem of a find ... Footnote: Maybe not suitable for people with young children or anybody with mobility problems as there is no lift, so I had to struggle up four floors of steepish, narrow stairs with my luggage - but this did concern me at all and I would definately book again. I believe there are some not so nice rooms down in the basement but if you end up with one of these maybe it is your own fault..when I made my booking I requested a clean and quiet room and that is exactly what I got ...Fab !!

Reviews.Title: “About the same, stayed here previously.”
Reviews.Author: matrix1000
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night. Booked a twin room to be used as a single. The hotel was clean and check in was fast and easy. The room was a good size with the usual amenitites. The room I got was in the basement, and u can hear the underground trains until about 12. The beds were comfortable and the sheets were clean. The heating worked and there was loads of coffee and tea. The toilet and bathroom was seperate, which is great if two of u were using the room. The bathroom had a powerful shower but it was a bit dark. The TV worked and reception was good. Breakfast was buffet style and full english. Tasted good and food was plentiful. I wish there was fruit however. But prompt service. This hotel has no WIFI. Overall I had a good night sleep not too noisy. But u can't beat the location, loads of eating places and the tube is a stone throw away. So I last stayed in this hotel 3 yrs ago, good to see that it hasn't deteriorated. But if I stay here again I would ask for a room thats not underground.

Reviews.Title: “Travelers be warned”
Reviews.Author: PastorMark
Reviews.Content: No hot water six of the seven mornings. Room and bathroom were not very clean. They never had more than a surface cleaning. The wife was very uncomfortable. The management thought fixing the problem was to clean the shower head. I explained to the repairman, as a retired commercial building contractor, the problem was the guest ratio to water pressure and heating ability ratio was inadequate to keep heating water and pressure. They made excuses when I asked for some money off that the manager was not coming in that day, her normal work day. Our wives had to wait till 9Am to take showers, which was when the water heated up and the pressure came back, thus missing breakfast. Us guys will go unrepresentable but few ladies will. The way they represent themselves as a hidden treasure at Kings Cross is not quite accurate. I am president of Christin Fellowship Churches Inc. and we went there with the intention of finding a place to send ten ministry couples every six months for sabbaticals. I even told the manager this and what they gave us was the best they can do? I think the basic that should be expected isn't new but clean rooms, sheets, and hot showers. I know London is an expensive city and rooms are small but as a person that travels two weeks of the month for the corporation in this capacity I can say with some experience this is a one star hotel with a three star breakfast. This is the truth and I warn travelers. Yes you get what you pay for but this is not what we thought we were paying for or represented as. This is not a place for reconnection and intimacy between couples. I didn't expect an five, four or three star hotel but clean and hot water isn't too much to ask. I was just going to let it go but it wouldn't be right. I think the management should contact me and make some kind of amends for other travelers and restitution. This is not a Mom and Pop business. This is owned by the Moreno four star hotel just around the corner. These are professionals and we should be able to expect more from them. I don't mean to be harsh I just think there should be a change.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: mia_and_pup
Reviews.Content: Booked a long weekend here with my partner after having being well looked after on numerous occasions at the California's sister hotel, the Montana Excel. What a disappointment! The rooms were basic with an en-suite, as expected. However, our rooms were not cleaned at all during our stay other than the bed linen being subtly re-arranged and the shower head was appallingly filthy. Refreshment sundries were not replenished and the lack of a bath mat meant there were quite a few close calls getting out of the shower. The temperamental heating, poor TV reception, non-functioning clock radio and the staff's disbelief at us asking for an ironing board (which never materialised) only further added to our irritation. Breakfast fayre was standard but in three days we were only asked if we wanted drinks on one occasion- the rest of the time we had to attempt to find a member of staff, which was no mean feat. To top it off the staff were either rude or mute at best, we were charged an extra 15GBP on top of the price quoted at booking which they would not back down on and we didn't even get a thank you or goodbye at any point during our stay! So, to sum up: over-priced, scabby rooms in a tired hotel that's seen better days and where the staff do not appear to understand the concept of good customer service. The only good thing about the place is the proximity to the Tube stop. Stay at the Montana Excel around the corner or the Premier Inn a little further up from King's Cross station.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Timeless
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last month as most people have said the location is ideal. On arriving it was pleasant enough then I was shown to my room which was down in the cellar where the cleaners kept things. Though the bedroom was ok double bed and a single bed tv and en suite bathroom which was freezing. The real downside was where the room was situated I hardly slept a wink through the noise and banging all night and come breakfast I thought that was included in the price was going to be charged Â£8 so declined. On the whole it is pretty cheap price for london but I doubt I'd stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't have stayed here longer, or on a family trip”
Reviews.Author: je11ybubb1es
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night for a works do that was arranged locally. Excellent location, right next to the Tube station. The rooms were very basic, the bathroom was very small and compact. I was staying with a close friend which was just as well, as you didn't really have much room to get ready. But hey - I was there for somewhere to crash after a heavy night of alcohol, and it was extremely acceptable for my purpose. However, if I was staying in London with family or needed to stay for any longer I would not have chosen this hotel. Breakfast was excellent though, and very welcome. Staff were also friendly. For the cost what do you expect?? It was clean and for one night I would happily stay here again if a similar party was organised.

Reviews.Title: “would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: arceliarn
Reviews.Content: family from California We stayed for 2 days . The bathroom was cold and the carpet old and dirty . There were no mats on the bathroom floor. I would definitely not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “dont bother”
Reviews.Author: ferrarifan
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay at this hotel for my birthday in November....i booked April 14th 2008. On arrival at the hotel we made quite welcome & given the keys to our room. On returning to ythe hotel at 10-45 we were told you are not staying here,they tried to tell us that we had been doubled booked,all our stuff was behind the reception waiting for us to collect. They said they had booked us into the the Jurys Inn on Pentonville rd,they gave us our money back & made up the rest to pay for the new room. We were then sent into the night like homeless people roaming around to find the new hotel which was a good walk away. I booked for B&B but the new room was room only so no breakfast for us unless we wanted to pay some ridiculous price,the actions of California hotel really spoilt my birthday & i certainly wouldn't ever book to go back there.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a night”
Reviews.Author: tony273
Reviews.Content: Liked the tiled-floor public areas and good buffet breakfast. Single room was tiny and cramped but was survivable for a one-night stay. Convenient location near Kings Cross.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: mistyuk759
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 separate nights on the way to and from Belgium on the Eurostar, the location was ideal as St Pancras international was a 2 minute walk away. From the outside the hotel looks inviting and the reception staff were very friendly and helpful. I was accompanied by my 83 year old mother which made getting up 2 flights of narrow stairs difficult, TV reception was awful and whilst the bed linnen was clean and fresh looking I could not say the same for the carpets and the room smelled of stale smoke, beds very uncomfortable. Our second night was to be 3 days later and although dubious we did not have much choice about staying here because at 83 my mum didn't need dragging round London looking for an alternative, I asked at reception if we could have a ground floor room on our return and the guy on reception was very helpful and swapped us to the ground floor from the 3rd floor, on our return the same things applied smell of stale smoke, pokey room with bad TV reception. Breakfast was poor and we didn't even bother the second time, the staff in the breakfast room were surly and unfriendly. All in all I would not stay here again and would not recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: PatRTexas
Reviews.Content: We checked in early, received a friendly welcome and were allowed to leave our luggage in the store room until check in time. Stairs were very difficult to manouver with anything but hand luggage or for anyone a bit out of shape. I had a small single room at the front facing the street. The room was hot and noisy. The window was broken off it's sash and had to be held open with a roll of toilet paper, definately a two man job. The mattress was hard and lumpy and I had the same towel for four days. On the good side there was a pleasant breakfast room, good breakfast, free wifi and friendly staff. There is a small terrace out back for smokers. The location couldn't have been better and the price was right. I would not stay there again nor recommend it to others. If the owners would invest in refurbishing, opening up the bar for evening cocktails and improve cleanliness this hotel would be a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go!!!”
Reviews.Author: bmth7
Reviews.Content: Arriving and looking from the outside this hotel looked lovely once you got inside you soon see why most of the reviews are correct. It's small, dirty and smells foul. When they were cleaning our room while we were out they left the door wide open with all our belongings in it, so it was open for all to see and pinch whatever they liked!! They didnt make the beds or give us fresh towels so what were they doing in our room, as we locked it when we left. It's small inside with tidy rooms and corridors, with very creaky floors we were woken up most morning with doors being slammed. The bed mattresses were about 3 inches thick, very uncomfortable and very worn, the beds were tiny for single ones and the room smelt of smoke and body odour! The only good thing about the hotel was the nice reception staff. I wouldn't advise anyone to stay here!! We took photos to put up on here but unfortuntely they didnt come out properly - sorry!

Reviews.Title: “would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: travellingcompanian
Reviews.Content: We arrived to a friendly greeting, however once we negotiated the very narrow stairs which were fairly grimy and went through the door to the corridor to our 2nd floor room we were initially met with a smell of stale cigarettes and body odour. Once in our room which was quite small, the carpets were threadbare and the bathroom so murky we actually just had washes as we could not face usuing the bath. The guests in the room above us were walking about until 2 am and kept us awake due to the load creaking of the floorboards. There were also some loud drunken guests on the same floor banging doors. The breakfast looked as if it had been out and kept warm for about 3 days the eggs were so hard you could have used them as pucks on an ice skating rink. We were so glad we had a full itinerary for our London trip so we spent as little time as possible in the hotel. On checking out the receptionist has us down as staying for 3 nights and not 2, if we had booked for 3 we would have left after the first night! We will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good location, bad beds”
Reviews.Author: lhcritter1974
Reviews.Content: The hotel has very small rooms and very un comfortable beds. It was clean and close to Kings Cross. The shower head didnt work, but the rest of the bathroom was fine. Never received clean towels but had to ask for them. Staff was friendly and had an English breakfast (the same selection every day).

Reviews.Title: “It all depends...”
Reviews.Author: ParisVoyager
Reviews.Content: Cons I booked a single which was a mistake. For Â£10 more, a double with single occupancy would doubtless have been better. Dangerously narrow, steep stairs( large luggage out). Despite booking 2 months in advance for 4 nights and mentioning difficulty with stairs, I was on the 2nd floor. No phone in a tiny room like a cabin with a bed like a bunk (only 80cm wide). To get to the WC you need to go through the shower cubicle... Overhead, fixed shower: too bad if you don't have a cap!Only one towel for 3 days! No bath mat. Sheets changed every 3 days (is this a hotel or a hostel?). Very bad TV (only two working channels) perched high on a shelf guaranteed to give you a crick in the neck if watched for any length of time. Never fixed or changed despite repeated complaints. Pros Generous amounts of tea and coffee in bedroom. A good, grilled, full English breakfast in buffet style (all you can eat). Pleasant dining room and bar. Busy, efficient staff. When the reading lamp bulb died it was replaced by a brand-new lamp. Everything looks spick and span. So as I said, it all depends on what you want from a hotel room for Â£50 in central London...

Reviews.Title: “Its good enough”
Reviews.Author: Von72
Reviews.Content: I was pretty nervous after reading some of the bad reviews but we found this hotel okay for the price. it was Â£70 for our double room plus travel cot which is good for london. the room was small but clean. the man on reception was so friendly when we checked in and so were all the staff. Breakfast was good and checkout problem free. its not the ritz but noone has paid for the ritz. We chose it because it was close to St Pancras as we were going on the eurostar. Its a 2 minute walk there. my parents said their room was cold but ours was fine. I'd stay here again and I'm quite fussy!

Reviews.Title: “great : ]”
Reviews.Author: tenminutestodowntown
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in January 2007 and thought it was excellent. The room for the money is great - it was clean and fairly comfortable and had a good bath room. The location is great ( 2 mins from Kings Cross Tube) and in a quiet street. We stayed there as we were going to a gig at the Scala and it is 5 minutes from this venue with a few nice pubs around to get food in. The hotel is a bit of a maze to get around...but we all felt this added to the fun of the place! I would definately reccomend this place to anyone wanting a clean, safe, friendly hotel on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Most Hideous Hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: MadameTussaud
Reviews.Content: Booked into this hotel for a friends birthday treat, turned into a nightmare. It is the most rundown, awful, filthy place I have ever had the misfortune to step into! We said we didn't like the room and were offered several others which were all the same and the staircase leading to them was stained and threadbare carpets which looked like rats had been chewing on it. The rooms had polystyrene drinking cups and the beds sunk in the middle one, was just a sofabed rather than a single too and that was worst of all, it must have been years old. The windows didn't lock and we were not allowed to keep our keys, we had to hand them in, this is awful when you have personal belongings in your room. We told the receptionist we could not stay there and he would not give us our money back and was extremely rude. He then gave me my money back but proceeded to process my bank card without my permission to get the money back. I am going to do everything in my power to get my money back even if it means going to court. An absolutely horrendous place, the receptionist even admitted that they had exaggerated on websites etc about their hotel and said it was companies who we booked throughs fault for not checking that the details were correct. AVOID at all costs or be warned. After much searching we found a lovely hotel round the corner, called the Princess Hotel, what a difference and it was cheaper too!!

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean bargain”
Reviews.Author: joramrose
Reviews.Content: When my passport came up missing on Saturday morning I was to leave UK, I had to stay over three days. This hotel offered me a good clean safe haven. My room was comfortabl, clean and cheerful. Staff friendly. Breakfast more than adequate. Bathroom exceptional. Enjoyed the marble lobby where guests gathered. Appreciated the location, convenient for both tube and bus. So the rooms are small? Even 4 star hotel rooms in London small. Yes, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location/service but be aware of bed bugs!!”
Reviews.Author: devy99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at California Hotel. Room was small but adequate for returning at night time whil we explored the town. Good location near Tube station. good breakfest and staff friendly. One neg note: we found a couple of bed bugs and my wife sustained several bites! Be aware thought that this is common in European hotels

Reviews.Title: “Wouldnt Stay Here Again If My Life Depended On It”
Reviews.Author: lucyNmick
Reviews.Content: Thread bare carpets, dirty, grimey, generally not pleasant. We walked into our room which was tiny. The double bed took up most of the floor space!! The tiny TV was INSIDE the wardrobe & the reception is so poor you barely get 1 channel!! At first we thought they hadn't given us an ensuite room until we realised what appears to be a built in wardrobe is actually the shower & toilet!!!! The door to the "en-suite" is a slatted wooden wardrobe door - not exactly private!! The mattress was thin, lumpy & uncomfortable - we had a dreadful nights sleep.The breakfast was awful & they gave us shot glasses for orange juice!! I wish we had gone somewhere else. A complete rip off for the Â£70 they charged us for one night - it will be Travel Lodge for us next time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: spookshow
Reviews.Content: The California is an average B&B, but in a great location for tube travel. Ok, the rooms are small, but they are clean and light. We booked a twin room, which consisted of 2 single beds, TV, a wash basin, wardrobes, a safe, and a separate bathroom with shower and toilet. There was also tea and coffee making facilities in the room. Bed linen was clean and towels also. Breakfast, if you are up early enough, (7am-9am!) is not bad, the usual bacon and eggs fry up with tea and juices. There was a small outdoor courtyard with benches towards the rear of the hotel for smoking or sunbathing. I found the staff to be friendly and helpful, and we were able to leave our bags in a locked storage on the day of our departure. We stayed for 2 nights over the weekend for a concert at the o2 arena and a days sightseeing and found this to be an excellent location for getting the tube all over london, and also only one stop from Euston for when we were going home. I enjoyed my stay here and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Clean and OK - but small pokey rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tripper21
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times since i first wrote a review, and my views have changed. Maybe its because i have stayed in a few different rooms, and they all seem small, cramped and a just a little bit too tatty. For Â£50/night its OK, and not quite dirty, but doesnt feel like the good value i first thought - maybe its me just changing my views. Stayed in a Travel Inn as an alternative, much larger room, clean bright etc, but at Â£100+ per room per night its nearly 2x the price, and you dont get free internet in Travel Inns. Right now I need to book again for a couple of weeks time, cant decide wether to rebook the California or not? (mind you, its not really my money I am spending, so the cost is less of an issue than it might be.)

Reviews.Title: “Basic, good location, ok for a base.”
Reviews.Author: purplerose239
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from a 4 night stay at the California Hotel and it was ok. I had a single room and I was travelling with 3 friends, one of them had a single room and the other 2 had a double. Location - Excellent, it is directly across the road from Kings Cross tube station. There are cash machines, a post office, various shops and eateries round about the area. Staff - Were fairly friendly, I didn't interact with them all that much aside from checking in and out and handing in my key and getting it back when we were going out for the day. They weren't chatty or anything, just done their jobs really. Foyer/Lobby area - Very clean and nice appearance. There is a computer terminal with internet access but it was out of order during our entire stay. It is possible to get coffee here and they also have a little back garden area. There is also a stand with lots of leaflets for London attractions, check them out because some have discounts on them which is handy. Getting to the room - this involved climbing up stairs in fairly narrow staircases. This was no problem to me but if stairs are a problem to you I'd see about asking for a room on the lower down floors. My room - My room was utterly tiny but it wasn't like I was planning on spending a great deal of time there so that was no big deal..The width of the room fit a single bed pushed against a wall with about a 2 foot space from the side of the bed to the other wall. The length of the room was from the top of the single bed to the bottom with about another 2 foot gap at the bottom. The 2 foot gap at the bottom had a built in wardrobe/dresser/mirror where there was space for a suitcase, clothes to hang, plenty of hangers, tea and coffee making facilities, a tv and a safe. There were no instructions for use of the safe but I went down to ask and they showed me how to do it. The side of the room that the bed was pushed against there was a radiator and a window which could be opened easily. Next to the bed there was a little shelf which held an alarm clock that had seen better days and a lamp. My room was located at the front of the hotel and whilst this is the side nearest to the main road I can't say the noise of traffic bothered me in the slightest. The bathroom - The bathroom was pretty small but adequate. It has a small bath with a shower, a toilet and a sink. There was extra toilet paper, 2 little bars of soap and one towel. The towel was the size of a hand towel so if you prefer a bigger towel either check if they can provide this or bring your own. Water pressure for the shower was fine and the temperature was good unlike some hotels I've been in. Cleanliness - General cleanliness of the room seemed ok, the bathroom was clean apart from the bottom door frame where it looked like coffee had splashed on there at some point. The room carpet looked like it could maybe do with a clean. The curtains smelled a bit foosty and the window was in dire need of a wash. Otherwise the sheets of the bed appeared to be clean and the surfaces were dust free. Friends single room - he was on the 4th floor above my room and he said his room was ok, his was a little bit larger than mine but his shower room wasn't so great. His shower consisted of walking into a small toilet cubicle with a shower head sticking out of the ceiling meaning everything in the toilet gets soaked. It was a pretty small cramped space too. Although we were aware that this could be the case from reading previous reviews on here. Friends double room - they say it was small, clean and basic. They were kept awake by some guests who were making noise out the back of the hotel in the early hours of the morning but that was the guests and isn't the hotels fault. In their bathroom the toilet handle fell off but they told the people in reception and it was fixed when we got back later that day and worked better than it had before. Breakfast - My friends went for breakfast but I didn't go near it as I don't like full english breakfasts but my two friends went and I was told it was very greasy but adequate. I'm told breakfast consisted of cereal, toast, sausages, bacon, eggs, tomatos, tea and coffee. Price - for a single room I was told Â£50 a night via email and that is how much it cost. However, it does say on the website that a room with a single bed is Â£45 and it's one with a double bed that is Â£50 so they've got a bit of a web discrepancy going on there. The prices displayed in the hotel match with the Â£50 a night price though. The double room was Â£70 per night. What isn't included - shampoo, hairdryer (but you can borrow one from the desk), telephone, instructions for the safe (but you can go ask how to use it). What would make it better - the rooms are painted in a nice yellow colour but the curtains, bedspread and carpet are patterned and a bit dowdy looking. It was also terribly hot in my room even with the window open a little fan or some kind of air conditioning would be good. A breakfast with lots of fresh fruit. Overall impression - I think this hotel made a good base for exploring London and for the money you can't really go wrong. The location was very good, we didn't explore the area very much but it's great for the tube. Yes the rooms were small but if all you need it for is a place to sleep and get washed then it's fine. It makes a good base and I would go back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very basic and good value for money!!”
Reviews.Author: Connie18
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful four day break from London and i have to say i was a bit wary before we went after reading some of the earlier reviews about this hotel, my worries were unfounded as the staff at this hotel were very freindly, the room was very clean and basic, not the ritz i must add but if its only a base you need while your out everyday then this is the place to stay, with the underground just around the corner you cant go wrong, oh and the breakfast was very nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: ItalianBari
Reviews.Content: I spent five day on this hotel and considering the London standards and the relatively low rate they asked me I was very worried about it but it turned out to be a nice surprise. The room was very small and so was the ensuite facility but everything was clean and the room was serviced every day. Breakfast was in a nice room painted in pastel colours and there was plenty of food each morning. The staff was very polite and helpful. In addition the hotel is just a few steps away one of the King's Cross station entrances from which you can go everywhere you like in London. So if you are looking for a cheap but nice accommodation in a strategic location and you are not the Ritz type I definitively recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel”
Reviews.Author: grannymo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel recently, the worst in my world travels, first - the room was not serviced, I mean the beds were not dressed, the towels were not changed or the bin emptied. There were no handtowels,or bath mat, no shampoo, soaps that had been used by others, and a safe that did not work, but worst of all no telephone, so I had to go all the way down the stairs to complain. There was no manager present. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. I must say that the staff at breakfast were really nice and friendly, and the breakfast was adequate for me but no choice.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I imagined!”
Reviews.Author: Jase_Cambs
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights while on a course in London. The hotel was booked by my company and I wasn't expecting much as: 1. They are a bit stingy 2. The hotel is in Kings Cross The hotel is about 200m from the train station, i'll let you decide if thats a good thing, but apparently KX is on the way up, and is nowhere near as bad as it used to be. I was pleasantly surprised to be honest, the outside of the hotel is well presented and the front desk staff were very helpful. I was in a twin with a double bed and a single bed, a decent sized bathroom with a bath and shower over. The room was cleaned every morning and the towels replaced. There was a safe in the room along with a wardrobe. There is free wifi which was a life saver! One thing to note is that other than soap there was no shampoo or shower gel etc (I travel prepared so was ok) From what I can work out the rooms are all being done up as there were some matresses and bed frames around. My room is one to still be done, it looked a bit tired, but was clean, which was the main thing! The lounge was nice, tastefully decorated, leading out to a well kept terrace area and there is a pc there for those without laptops. Breakfast is between 7-9 and is buffet style with mountains of toast, bacon, sausages as well as poached eggs, beans and tomatoes. There was some cerial as well and juice, tea and coffee. The room where breakfast is served is really nice and bright and with plenty of room. Overall I was pretty impressed with my stop here, it would have been nice to be in one of the newer rooms, but I imagine in a year or so once everything is finished it will be a really good hotel. The owner is really trying to make an effort with the hotel, and being in Kings Cross there is every type of food available close by.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel California
HotelInfo.Address: 4-8 Belgrove Street | Kings Cross, London WC1H 8AB, England
